result.execSummary:
The defendant James D Carlisle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a condition of extended supervision

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
10:11 AM This case is being called for a plea and sentencing hearing. Defendant James D Carlisle in court, in custody.  Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for James D Carlisle.  Attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for State of Wisconsin. Court notes there was a plea questionnaire filed and goes over the offer. Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 with the repeater enhancer struck and Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 & 2. Court orders Count 3 dismissed and read in and cases 22TR4693 and 22TR4803 are dismissed and read into this case.

Sentencing arguments made by Atty Nickolie.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty Galaviz.
Defendant presents statements.

COUNT 1:

The Court Orders the Following:

2 Years and 6 months Imprisonment (Credit - 50 days; consecutive to any other current sentence)
-	1 Year of Initial Confinement
-	1 Year and 6 Months of Extended Supervision

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

DL REVOCATION: 6 months.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
-	Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
-	Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent;
-	Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s;
-	No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
-	No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid doctor's prescription

COSTS:  $268.00

DNA Surcharge: $250.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid during term of imprisonment and during extended supervision. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment; 

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  
 
COUNT 2:

The Court Orders the Following:

4 Years Imprisonment (consecutive to COUNT 1 and any other current sentence)
-	2 Years of Initial Confinement
-	2 Years of Extended Supervision

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

DL REVOCATION: 6 months.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
-	Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
-	Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent;
-	Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s;
-	No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
-	No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid doctor's prescription

COSTS:  $268.00

DNA Surcharge: $250.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid during term of imprisonment and during extended supervision. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment; 

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:15 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James D Carlisle in court, in custody at WCJ.  Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for James D Carlisle.  Court notes a plea questionnaire has been filed and recites the offer as listed in the document, noting that based on discussions off the record the OWI first case will be adjourned for status as the blood test results have not come in yet.  Atty. Nickolie notes the offer was that the repeater enhancer would only be struck on one of the Counts the defendant is pleading to and remain on the other.   Based on that Atty. Galaviz needs more time to re-review the offer with his client and is asking for a new plea and sentencing date.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

8:35 AM Defendant James D Carlisle in court, in custody.  Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for James D Carlisle.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Shawn Woller in court for State of Wisconsin.Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

State Public Defender's Office Law Intern appeared for the defense by Erick Schlueter. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.
